title: Barbecue: Burnt Ends Recipe
full_text:
Barbecue: Burnt Ends Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
5 mins
Cook
2 hrs
Active
60 mins
Cooling Time
10 mins
Total
2 hrs 15 mins
Serves
8
to 10 servings
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1
freshly smoked brisket
point
, separated from flat if cooked whole
1
cup
your favorite
barbecue sauce
, plus more for serving
1/2
cup
drippings
from
smoked brisket
, if reserved
Directions
Cut smoked brisket point into 1/2-inch cubes and place in a large disposable tray. Add in 1 cup of barbecue and brisket drippings, if reserved, and toss to thoroughly coat brisket pieces.
Place tray back in smoker and smoke at 225 degrees until brisket pieces darken and become crisp around the edges, 2 to 4 hours.
Remove from smoker, let cool for 10 minutes, then serve, with additional barbecue sauce, if desired.
Special Equipment
Smoker or grill
Brisket
Soul Food & Southern
Smoked Beef
Summer Mains
